issue.title: [ENH] Add Fourier featurizer

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
There is no Fourier featurizer to model seasonality in forecasting pipelines.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add a `FourierFeatures` transformer, similar to the `DateTimeTransformer` (#1273)

**Additional context**
Related issues: #1675

issue.title: Add holiday features

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
Fixes #1675 

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
* adds `HolidayFeatures`

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
soft dependency: holidays https://pypi.org/project/holidays/

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?


#### Any other comments?


#### PR checklist

##### For all contributions
- [x] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [x] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [x] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [x] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.

body: Someone else can take this if interested, some preliminary work is in #1722

issue.title: [ENH] reconciliation at different temporal aggregation levels

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
We should include functionality that makes reconciliation at different temporal aggregation levels easy, e.g., weekly and monthly; or weekly, daily, monthly.

I think @rikstarmans has shown in https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/3776 (in his pasted code) how to do this easiest - simply split up the time stamp in week/day multiindex etc and apply the current reconciler (is that correct, @rikstarmans?)

If that works, we should:

* add the code of @rikstarmans, or a slightly more general version, to `sktime`
* fix the bug in https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/3776
* possibly wrap the composition (nesting pipeliens is maybe clunky) as a forecaster wrapper

Thoughts?
